reviews.title: Average hotel; great location
reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is its location. It's located within easy walking distance of many attractions. The hotel itself is average overall and slightly below average for the Radisson chain. The rooms are small, though they aren't much smaller than a typical European hotel room. They are, however, dated, and the mattresses seemed a bit old. The bathroom was nicely decorated, but the shower door didn't seal properly, and much of our shower water spilled out onto the floor. When we told the management about this, they said that they knew about the problem and told us to stuff some towels under the shower door to prevent leakage. Others we traveled with had the same problem in their rooms. The breakfast buffet is not very impressive compared to many hotels, but the food is decent, and there's usually a good amount of it. The bar/cafe area was nice, and the staff were friendly. We booked this hotel as part of a package deal, so I don't know how much we actually paid for the rooms. Overall, our stay here was ok. If you're looking for a hotel in a good location and don't mind a room along the lines of one found in a dated Motel 6, this is reasonable choice.

reviews.title: Average hotel, not 4-stars
reviews.text: I selected this hotel because of the included internet connection, which is important to me during a business trip. The rate found was 30% lower than the Hilton, so the choice was easy. I stayed before at the Radisson in Berlin and expected something on the same line.

reviews.title: Worlds smallest Fitness Centre
reviews.text: Location is good. I knew exactly where it was, and both for tourists and business people it's a good location in the city. The room at this hotel (608) was big-enough (I don't expect 40sqm but appreciate when I get them), and first idea took me to the standard IBIS hotels I stayed in. Bed was king, but 2 sepparate covers. This makes it uncomfortable at nights, especially when travelling alone. Bathroom was small but clean, but the sink was very small and drain almost stuck. The tub (no shower) was very narrow, i could barely fit when sitting down, and I am a thin person.

reviews.title: A massive disappointment
reviews.text: Breakfast diversity was OK, but again not up to 4-stars expectations. I had better breakfast in IBIS. Organisation of the restaurant was very poor, with bread and drinks table next to entrance, which made it hard to navigate in the restaurant.

reviews.title: The Radisson name is put to shame with this hotel.
reviews.text: During my stay they had a dinner promotion advertised in the elevators. When I went to try it, they told me it was postponed with few days, which I thought was unprofessional.

It would have been nice to be able to afford one of the pricey hotels on the river. But the Radisson offered many fine qualities. It had a good location on a busy thoroughfare with lots of restaurants nearby and the river and museums in close walking distance. The Internet was good (and free!), and the room was fine. The price was good at 70 Euros per night.
reviews.title: Good value for the money

reviews.text: The breakfast was expensive, so I ate at nearby bakeries and even had a breakfast burrito a couple of blocks away, all on the same avenue.
reviews.title: Great Location
Hotel Beke
reviews.text: Two gripes: I found the front desk staff to be a bit distant, not very warm in answering my dumb tourist questions. And the charge for washing clothes was too high.
In all, though, I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Location,Location, Location!

reviews.text: We visited Budapest during a Globus Imperial Splendors escorted tour. Of all the hotels in the tour package, the Beke Radisson had probably the best location. Located less than 500 meters from the Oktogon metro station at Andrassy Street, which is the main shopping boulevard in Budapest, it is about half way between Heroes' Square and the Danube. The metro is only required if you're tired, because it is reasonable walking distance in both directions. It is within just a couple blocks of the House of Terror Museum and the Menza cafe.

reviews.title: absolutely awesome
reviews.text: The staff were really helpful, polite, and couldn't do enough for us! The rooms were really spacious with a good mini-bar which wasn't too expensive compared to others! location was also good, with most things within walking distance! The only problem i had was the room service wasn't very good, although, it was around 3am! and the pool is alot smaller than expected but to be honest there was too much to do in budapest to worry about it anyway! all in all 10/10 and thanks to all the staff for there efforts it making the holiday an enjoyable experience

reviews.title: Kind of yuckie
reviews.text: Ok... I am going to try to write this as nicely as possible. It was really kind of gross. You see the exterior and your like wow... this is gonna be nice, but then you walk inside and you are like oh I am in 1970's Vegas. It was really kind of an eye sore when you walk in. The employees were really ... not nice and kind of short (quick tempered). We were really tired from our trip and then we get to room wanting to shower... oh it was really very icky looking. Kind of grimy. The room had a fishy like odor and the beds were very lumpy as were the pillows. I didn't really want to touch anything, but I did.... kind of had too. There was a lot of noise outside, but only because they were fixing the road (most likely they fixed it by now). The power was knocked out once and no I didn't use a hairdryer. The one good thing was the food in the restaurant of the hotel. It was really good. The hotel was in a really good location. Budapest is so breathtaking. It really didn't matter after we ventured out. I would never stay in this hotel again.
